description: Number of prime triples < 10^n, where a prime triple means 3 successive primes of the form {p, p+2, p+4} or {p, p+4, p+6}.
references: J. Recreational Math., vol. 23, No. 2, 1991, p. 97.
links: Index entries for sequences related to numbers of primes in various ranges
mathematica: x=168; a=Table[ Prime[ n ], {n, 1, x} ] c=0; Do[ If[ a[[ n ]]+6==a[ [ n+2 ] ], c++ ], {n, 1, x-2} ]; c # the values of x to use are given by A006880
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 09 2000
